title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CLEVELAND – In a defensive battle where points were a premium, the Miami Heat secured a gritty 90-78 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers. But this game will not be remembered for the final score; it will be immortalized for the superhuman, historic performance of Miami’s Alonzo Mourning.

Mourning was not merely a player on the court; he was an unstoppable force of nature. He erupted for a staggering 48 points, a titanic effort that single-handedly broke the will of the Cavaliers. On a night where the rest of his team combined for just 42 points, Mourning’s dominance in the paint was absolute and awe-inspiring. He was the offense, the defense, and the very heart of the Heat’s triumph.

While Mourning’s scoring barrage was the main event, he was not without a crucial accomplice. Point guard Tim Hardaway orchestrated the affair, dishing out a game-high 15 assists, many of which found a rolling Mourning for thunderous finishes. On the other side, Cleveland’s Wesley Person provided a valiant counterpoint, sinking five three-pointers on his way to 23 points, but it was a flicker against the inferno of Mourning.

The Cavaliers simply had no answer. Shawn Kemp, held to a quiet 10 points, was rendered a non-factor against the Heat center’s two-way ferocity. This was more than a win; it was a statement carved into the annals of NBA history. In an era defined by physicality, Alonzo Mourning delivered a performance for the ages, a 48-point masterpiece that cemented his legacy as one of the most dominant big men of his generation.
